text.p: Excite Inc said Tuesday that Microsoft Corp's WebTV Network renewed Excite as its primary default Web search service for another year.

The agreement extends the partnership the companies first entered last October, enabling Excite Search to be accessed directly from the "search" button on the main WebTV Network service page. In addition, Excite Search will also now add new features for enhanced search capabilities.

With this agreement, Excite becomes a search partner on three of Microsoft's properties. Excite Search is also featured on Internet Explorer 3.0 and 4.0, and is the exclusive search service in the Excite channel on Internet Explorer 4.0.
Despite the renewed agreement with Excite, industry executives have said Microsoft is continuing to develop its own search engine which would be a direct competitor to Excite and Yahoo! Inc.
